message_1: If p represents the statement "2 is divisible by 3" and q represents the statement "5 is a prime number," what is the truth value of the statement "p implies q"? (Assign the value of 1 for True and 0 for False).
message_2: The statement "p implies q" can be written as "if p, then q." In this case, p is false because 2 is not divisible by 3, and q is true because 5 is a prime number. In logic, "if false, then true" is considered true. Therefore, the truth value of the statement "p implies q" is 1 (True).
